New Records: Merih Demiral scored the fastest-ever goal in the knockout stage of a European Championship (57 seconds)
Key Match Events: Merih Demiral scored for Turkey after 57 seconds following a series of Austrian errors
Mert Gunok made a spectacular save to prevent a goal in the final seconds of the game
Arda Guler delivered pinpoint corners that led to two of Merih Demiral's goals
Post-Match Reflections: Ralf Rangnick, Austria manager: 'Not everything went very accurately, but they were four very entertaining and intense games. Now we need to take this with us into the Nations League (in the autumn) and then into World Cup qualifying (starting in March). I cannot believe we are going home today, we thought we were going to continue our journey.'
Mert Gunok, Turkey goalkeeper: 'We still have a long way to go, if it's God's will, we will go to the very end. We believe this. This win took us to the next level in terms of morale and confidence.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Plastic cups were thrown at players from the stands
The match was played in heavy rain
Turkey's performance showcased tactical versatility and high-octane play
